title: Marion Seve
text:
Marion Seve (born 27 May 1995) is a <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>.
Early life.
Seve was born in <a href="Ipswich%2C%20Queensland">Ipswich, Queensland</a>, Australia. He is the one of seven children of a Samoan boxer. 
He was educated at <a href="Keebra%20Park%20State%20High%20School">Keebra Park State High School, Gold Coast</a>, where he was the recipient of the <a href="Peter%20Sterling%20Medal">Peter Sterling Medal</a> after winning the <a href="GIO%20Schoolboy%20Cup">2013 GIO Schoolboy Cup</a>. Seve was also a <a href="Australian%20Schoolboys%20rugby%20league%20team">2013 Australian Schoolboys</a> representative.
Marion played his junior representative football with <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> until 2016 where he signed with the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>.
In 2018, Seve signed with the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> mid season.
Playing career.
In Round 2 of the <a href="2019%20Melbourne%20Storm%20season">2019 NRL season</a>, Seve made his debut for the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> against the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Raiders</a>. He had his Melbourne Storm jersey presented to him by Melbourne Storm coach <a href="Craig%20Bellamy%20%28rugby%20league%29">Craig Bellamy</a>.
Seve mid season was named in the <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Toa Samoa</a> team to make his international debut. During the post-season, he was named in the Samoan team to contest the <a href="2019%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%209s">2019 Rugby League World Cup 9s</a>.
